benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/allCustomFields - Retrieve account customFields

covered: Valid Request: Core successful retrieval scenarios are covered (TC01, TC02, TC05) including objectType and audit filters.
Empty Response: No-data scenarios covered (TC06, TC07) to validate empty-array responses.
Query Parameters: Extensive coverage for objectType and audit parameter permutations and invalid formats (TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC08, TC09, TC31, TC32, TC36).
Authorization: Authentication failure scenarios are present (TC14, TC15) validating 401 responses for missing/invalid tokens.
Error Handling: Input validation and error responses covered (invalid UUID format TC12, non-existent account TC13, extremely long/empty/whitespace accountId TC33-TC35).
Security: Injection and XSS attempts are explicitly tested (TC17, TC18).
Resilience & Integration: Service-unavailable, dependency failure and retry/recovery behaviors are tested (TC16, TC20, TC23, TC39).
Performance: Large dataset and concurrency/heavy-load scenarios are present (TC11, TC25, TC26).
gaps: Pagination: No tests exercise pagination behavior (limit/offset or server-side paging) or assert how large result sets are paged; TC11 checks large dataset but does not validate pagination semantics.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests that verify API behavior when rate limits are exceeded (429) or how bursts are handled.
Caching Behavior: No scenarios validate caching headers (ETag, Last-Modified, Cache-Control) or conditional GET behavior (304 Not Modified).
Authorization: Role-based authorization and 403 Forbidden cases are not covered (e.g., valid token but insufficient permissions).
Response Headers & Content-Type: Tests do not assert standard HTTP headers (Content-Type, Content-Length, paging headers if any) or response charset.
Pagination-related performance: While performance under load is present, there are no tests that combine pagination + performance or measure streaming/partial-result behavior.
Rate-limit related recovery: No tests check backoff/retry behavior in client when receiving rate-limit responses or whether server provides Retry-After header.
recommendations: Add explicit pagination tests (if API supports paging) that verify limit/offset/page parameters, paging headers, and behavior when requesting out-of-range pages. Include tests for large datasets that assert either all results are returned (if no pagination) or are correctly partitioned with consistent ordering across pages.
Implement rate-limiting tests: simulate bursts of requests to validate responses (429), ensure Retry-After header is present and behavior under sustained high request rates.

Add caching tests: verify ETag/Last-Modified and Cache-Control headers are present and correct; test conditional GET using If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since to confirm 304 responses and validate freshness/invalidation after changes.
Cover authorization beyond authentication: add tests for 403 Forbidden where an authenticated principal lacks permission, and validate error payloads/headers for authorization failures.
Assert HTTP response headers and content-type on successful and error responses (Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8, Content-Length, any custom headers).

If pagination is unsupported by design, add an explicit acceptance test documenting that the endpoint returns all results and include a safety/performance test to ensure behavior is acceptable for very large result sets (memory/timeout).
Add rate-limit recovery/backoff tests and ensure clients receive and honor Retry-After where applicable.
Augment performance tests to combine concurrency with large-result sets and measure end-to-end latency, memory, and DB impact; include monitoring/alerting assertions where feasible.
